History: Patient reports that she finds it difficult to maintain focus and concentration once she starts working on writing her papers or completing her assignments. Even though she begins by gathering references, she easily gets distracted by checking the news, using phone, or browsing unrelated websites, which hampers her productivity. This results in stress to complete the papers within tight deadlines. She reports that she is unable to control herself from wandering away from the topic on which she is working at that point of time.
Current Mental Status Examination: Affect seems to be anxious; At time patient replies to the therapist before he/she finishes the question or provides an opinion; There is no evidence of any perceptual abnormality.
Psychotherapy Technique: Reflective listening, Problem Solving, Contingency management
Issues discussed in Current Session: The focus of the current session was completing a paper well before the deadline
Reflections by the therapist: The patient was co-operative during the interview and actively involved in the session. At times, she would jump to answer to the questions asked before the question being completed. However, she understood the homework given to her well. She had been receptive to the therapist's advise in her past sessions as well.
Action Plan: Reinforcement of the act of completing her paper writing by providing a reward in the form of watching episodes with her husband only after she completes writing 1 page, Thought monitoring
Next session details: Next session is to be taken after 2 weeks
